meanings.definition: Characterized by refined taste and manners
meanings.sent1: She was a cultured lady who always knew the right thing to say.
meanings.sent2: The art exhibit attracted a cultured audience who appreciated the finer details.
meanings.sent3: Even the dog seemed more cultured than the rest of the family, sitting politely at the table.
meanings.sent4: Her cultured demeanor shone like a polished gem in the midst of the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The cultured atmosphere of the opera house left a lasting impression on the visitors.

meanings.definition: Produced or grown in a controlled environment
meanings.sent1: The cultured mushrooms in the greenhouse were thriving under the careful supervision.
meanings.sent2: The cultured pearls were meticulously crafted by skilled artisans.
meanings.sent3: The laboratory proudly displayed its collection of cultured bacteria, all grown under strict conditions.
meanings.sent4: The cultured plants in the hydroponic system flourished without any pests to disturb them.
meanings.sent5: The cultured fish in the tank swam gracefully, a testament to their controlled upbringing.

meanings.definition: Having been subjected to a specific process of cultivation or development
meanings.sent1: The cultured cells in the petri dish were ready for the next stage of experimentation.
meanings.sent2: The cultured yogurt had a tangy flavor that set it apart from the regular variety.
meanings.sent3: The scientist proudly presented his cultured bacteria, the result of months of careful nurturing.
meanings.sent4: Her cultured mind absorbed knowledge like a sponge, always eager to learn more.
meanings.sent5: The cultured wine had a rich aroma, a testament to the years of careful aging.
